### Get data

This R Markdown file formalizes the process for input data to the SoVI & SEMS NPL sites study. The three datasets are:

1. [SoVI data](https://svi.cdc.gov/SVIDataToolsDownload.html)
    * Data is available for the years 2000, 2010, 2014, 2016; 
    * Current script downloads the 2016 data.
2. [USA Counties](https://www.census.gov/geo/maps-data/data/cbf/cbf_counties.html)
3. [SEMS NPL Sites](https://toxmap-classic.nlm.nih.gov/toxmap/search/download.do;jsessionid=29497C681B1A0844E4E7660F17DA2B81)


```{r, eval = FALSE}

# SoVI data (2016)

download.file("https://svi.cdc.gov/Documents/Data/2016_SVI_Data/SVI2016_US.zip",
              "~/projects/superfund/superfund/raw/new_data/svi2016_us.zip")

# U.S. Counties

download.file("http://www2.census.gov/geo/tiger/GENZ2017/shp/cb_2017_us_county_20m.zip",
              "~/projects/superfund/superfund/raw/cb_2017_us_county_20m.zip")

# Superfund Sites

download.file("https://toxmap-classic.nlm.nih.gov/toxmap/download/superfund_shapefile.zip",
              "~/projects/superfund/superfund/raw/superfund_shapefile.zip")

```

The data are downloaded as zip files and can be extracted and subsequently fed into the analysis.
